conclusion: Determine the propagation time of light in the prism using properties of the isosceles prism and triangle geometry.
Vertex angle of isosceles prism ABC is 30 degrees, side length of AB is L, light DO hits midpoint O of AB, incident angle is 45 degrees, propagation speed of light in vacuum is C.
DO is half the length of AB, therefore DO = L/2.
AO = BO because triangle is isosceles; angle at O is 45 degrees, so triangle AOB is equilateral, thus AO = OB = AB = L/2.
Using Pythagorean theorem, AO^2 = AB^2 - BO^2 = (L/2)^2 - (L/2)^2 = 0, thus AO = OB = AB = L/2.
Repeated calculation using Pythagorean theorem confirms AO = OB = AB = L/2.
